description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ak7qk","text":"PROgrammable Full-length Isoform Transcriptome sequencing (PROFIT-seq) is a method that enriches target transcripts while maintaining unbiased quantification of the whole transcriptome. PROFIT-seq employs combinatorial reverse transcription to capture polyadenylated, non-polyadenylated, and circular RNAs, coupled with nanopore adaptive sampling that selectively enriches target transcripts during sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
